title: I think im done
body:
Ever met a girl and instantly fell in love to the point where everything she does amazes you then over time she changes and soon you realize you dont like what she is anymore and being with her just bothers you now 

yeah that what i feel about riot/league now

i ll still play this game because of the time and money i have invested into it but i am not sure ill ever get that fun feeling i used to get when i played back then
who knows maybe i might go and play counter strike instead

Hey man, great post.

I'm not an expert in formal psychology, but I think over my 2 years here on the forums I've learned a bit about the nature of toxicity. 

I'm sure you know someone who is a genuinely good person, but they get in-game and become a monster. Or even worse you may have even seen this person grow more and more toxic. 

_How does this happen?
How do players become **toxic**?_

+ **Expectations.**
Players dedicate a lot of time to this game. The issue appears when people expect results from their time investment and they don't get it. Players might begin to feel resentment towards their teams and the system.

 This is where players begin to be hyper critical of their team mates, and will often see them as deadweight. Everyone seems to be a scrub, always making mistakes, always holding you back from your real potential.

 The more you expect or dedicate to something, the more it'll hurt when things fall apart. This is why relationships can be so emotionally scarring in some cases.

+ **Mimic.**
[Studies show](http://press.uchicago.edu/pressReleases/2014/May/0522JCRlowe.html) that your company and who you associate with dictates your character and actions greatly. New players may come from darker areas of the internet, or experience toxicity and assume it's the normal or accepted.

 A huge part of the player report system is to fix this. It's very important that players understand that this behavior is not OK. **Riot Lyte** has a great talk on this [here](http://gdcvault.com/play/1017940/The-Science-Behind-Shaping-Player).

+ **Reaction.**
Not everyone has iron skin when it comes to toxicity. Bad days or simply being fed up with the community can lead to anger and resentment of teams and the system.

 These players will flame back at toxic players only worsening the problem and causing it to spiral out of control. They aren't bad people, but they feel the need to take matters into their own hands and correct the issue themselves. They'll stop negative players as people, and just "more trolls" or "the problem in the community". 

 The truth is most players are good people, with genuine problems and issues. They don't understand that maybe these players aren't assholes, maybe they are going through financial struggles, death, break-ups... etc. These players don't need to be excluded and unwelcome, they need help and support.

We're always working to fix toxicity in the community, but the truth is out impact is limited. _**The community is a product of the players**_, what you say and how you act defines the community.

If you do something nice, you'll generate **positivity**. If you bring hate, you'll generate **negativity**. If you just play, you'll do **nothing**.

If you're looking for my message in **TL;DR** form, I recommend checking out this video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nxAabW7JfTQ

I hope this helps ;)
